dismissalText.commentary: Nicholas Pooran b Taijul Islam 73 (109b 4x4 2x6 146m) SR: 66.97

dismissalComment.html: Fifer for Taijul! Tossed up delivery outside off turning in, moves towards the line of the ball, tries to play it across the line to the onside, misses the line and length completely, clean bowled!
Finally, Pooran's outstanding innings has come to an end.

images.caption: Nicholas Pooran gets low and plays a shot late
images.longCaption: Nicholas Pooran gets low and plays a shot late, West Indies vs Bangladesh, 3rd ODI, Providence, July 16, 2022

headshotImage.caption: Tamim Iqbal headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Tamim Iqbal headshot

dismissalText.long: c Tamim Iqbal b Nasum Ahmed
dismissalText.commentary: Keacy Carty c Tamim Iqbal b Nasum Ahmed 33 (66b 2x4 1x6 82m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: Gifted his wicket away! Short of a length ball onto the stumps, moves away to make room, attempts to swing it away over the mid on fielder, mistimes it straight in the air. Tamim settles underneath at the mid on region and collects it with ease.
Both the batters are quite disappointed with the dismissal.

images.caption: Nasum Ahmed got rid of Keacy Carty
images.longCaption: Nasum Ahmed got rid of Keacy Carty, West Indies vs Bangladesh, 3rd ODI, Providence, July 16, 2022

headshotImage.caption: Shai Hope player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shai Hope player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Slower in the air delivery on middle-off turning away, Hope attempts to play it through covers, gets beaten by the turn. Appeal for a stumping, decision is sent upstairs. The batter is short of his ground as the keeper breaks the stumps. Shohan did a fantastic job behind the stumps.

headshotImage.caption: Rovman Powell player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rovman Powell player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Cleaned up! Quicker good length onto the stumps with a hint of turn, Powell moves away from the wicket to make room, misses the line and length completely, crashes onto the middle stump.
Third wicket for Taijul

headshotImage.caption: Keemo Paul, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Keemo Paul, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalComment.html: Excellent work by Nurul again behind the stumps! Good length ball on middle-off turning away from the batter, beats the outside edge but Nurul does the rest behind the stumps. Decision is sent upstairs but Paul is already walking off. He is short of his ground as Nurul breaks the wickets.
Taijul picks up another one!

headshotImage.longCaption: Shamarh Brooks player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Short of a good length ball on middle-off angling in, attempts to play it across the line and misses the length, thuds the back pad. Massive appeal and the umpire has given him OUT! Brooks opts to review the decision after a quick chat with his partner. Ultra edge confirms no bat involved, impact in line, pitching in line and clipping the top of the middle stump.

commentPreTextItems.html: Shah Safeer: "I wonder what would Windies legends like Clive Lloyd, Sir Richards, Sir Sobers must be thinking about this unit? It's hars to believe this team had lifted the initial two Cricket World Cup Trophies and started arguably the best era for any team in this sport's history! "

commentTextItems.html: Back of a length ball outside off, hangs back and steers it through covers and sets off for a single.

commentPostTextItems.html: That's all from today's game. This is Rashad Mahbub signing off on behalf of Ranjith. Take care and goodnight.

Tamim Iqbal: Yeah definitely I am proud of our achievement. We have been always a good side at home but this is back to back away series' that we have won I think. I am very proud of the group. It wasn't the easiest condition you know, though we had the better spinners probably. But the bowlers utilized it extremely well. Definitely we are missing three players from top 5. So this was a great opportunity for these guys and I think they have stepped up, especially players like Shohan. Whenever he got an opportunity he was cool and calm, today was another example and he batted really well. I think this is something good that is happening for the Bangladesh cricket. {The greatest takeaways} from the series would be the way Nasum bowled and the way Shohan batted. Miraz has been always good for us. But these two was something else and I have to mention Taijul's name. Throughout the tour he was with the team but did not get a game, came in to every practice sessions but whenever he got the game he finally stepped up. So there are few things we will definitely take back.
Tamim Iqbal is the player of the series for the sixth time in his ODI career.

Taijul Islam: I am very fortunate to get the opportunity today and I have worked really hard mentally and practiced very hard for the opportunity. Because we know Shakib Al Hasan, Nasum and a lot of guys in the left arm spin department. So I am very glad that I got the opportunity and I have made the full use of it. There was no additional pressure on me. I just tried to stick on to my basics, bowl according to the wicket and that clicked for me.
Taijul Islam is the player of the match for his brilliant bowling figure of 5/28

4:46pm local time: Bangladesh wins the game by four wickets and completes a 3-0 sweep of the three-match series. After Shanto left, Bangladesh continued to advance toward victory despite his continuous poor performance. There was no strain on Tamim and Litton when they batted. Litton and Riyad were gradually lengthening the innings after Tamim left. Litton and Afif were then both removed after Motie struck twice in quick succession. The middle order batters of BD were tested for the first time in the series. The batters frequently gave away their wickets. Later, Nurul and Mehidy succeeded in getting to the required target score. They have played calmly, avoiding unneeded risks. Motie, who picked up four wickets with his excellent bowling, was assisted by Joseph, who was also quite economical with the ball. Rovman Powell and Keemo Paul were greatly missed by West Indies on the field. Only if West Indies had scored an additional 20 to 30 runs things would have been different today.

dismissalText.commentary: Shamarh Brooks lbw b Mustafizur Rahman 4 (8b 1x4 0x6 17m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: Short of a good length ball on middle-off angling in, attempts to play it across the line and misses the length, thuds the back pad. Massive appeal and the umpire has given him OUT! Brooks opts to review the decision after a quick chat with his partner. Ultra edge confirms no bat involved, impact in line, pitching in line and clipping the top of the middle stump.

dismissalText.long: c Tamim Iqbal b Nasum Ahmed
dismissalText.commentary: Keacy Carty c Tamim Iqbal b Nasum Ahmed 33 (66b 2x4 1x6 82m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: Gifted his wicket away! Short of a length ball onto the stumps, moves away to make room, attempts to swing it away over the mid on fielder, mistimes it straight in the air. Tamim settles underneath at the mid on region and collects it with ease.
Both the batters are quite disappointed with the dismissal.
